codeSystems.name: FHIR Restful Interactions
codeSystems.description: The set of interactions defined by the RESTful part of the FHIR specification.

codeSystems.name: AuditEventEntityRole
codeSystems.title: AuditEventEntityRole
codeSystems.description: Code representing the role the entity played in the audit event.
codeSystems.ValueSet-RestObjectRoles.html: RESTful objects role in the event

codeSystems.name: IdentifierType
codeSystems.title: identifierType
codeSystems.description: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying type of identifier. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging data types CX, PLN, PPN, XCN and XON.

codeSystems.name: ObservationValue
codeSystems.title: ObservationValue
codeSystems.description: This code system covers all concepts of HL7-defined values for the Observation value element, when it has a coded datatype.

codeSystems.name: ParticipationType
codeSystems.title: ParticipationType
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every Participation instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints on the Roles undertaking the participation.
codeSystems.ValueSet-DataSources.html: participant source types for RESTful create

codeSystems.name: AuthZsubType
codeSystems.title: Authorization subType events
codeSystems.description: These AuditEvent subTypes are related to Authorization Decisions. These are more specific types of Security Alert.

codeSystems.name: BasicAuditEntityType
codeSystems.title: Entity Types that are defined in IHE BasicAudit
codeSystems.description: These are new codes used in BasicAudit IG, where AuditEvent.entity is used to hold a specific kind of data that is not covered by the existing valueSet.
codeSystems.ValueSet-BasicAuditEntityTypesVS.html: Entity Types used by IHE BasicAudit

codeSystems.name: OtherIdentifierTypes
codeSystems.title: OtherId Identifier Types
codeSystems.description: OtherId Types beyond those in the FHIR core

codeSystems.name: UserAgentTypes
codeSystems.title: The code used to identifiy a User Agent
codeSystems.description:
Code used to identify the User Agent.
Defined codes for SAML vs OAuth to enable differentiation of .policy as the token ID
